pullrequest.title: Fix for Issue #365: warn when messages are dropped

content.raw:
I really like the cmake macro; anything that makes setting up unit tests easier will make them more likely to occur.

Also, to clarify, the `gzlog` logging mechanism is an output stream, not the command-line tool.

Also, I updated this pull request to `gzwarn` the first time the queue limit is reached, with a message indicating that future warnings would be directed to a log file. Also, I put the path to the log file, but if that changes, the message will be out of date.
content.html:
I really like the cmake macro; anything that makes setting up unit tests easier will make them more likely to occur.

Also, to clarify, the gzlog logging mechanism is an output stream, not the command-line tool.

Also, I updated this pull request to gzwarn the first time the queue limit is reached, with a message indicating that future warnings would be directed to a log file. Also, I put the path to the log file, but if that changes, the message will be out of date.
